intro: Aeschynomene subaphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides, and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
